# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

You can use the `lowercasefirst` function from the `Text` module in Julia's standard library to clean your column name. Here is how you would implement this:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(replace(lowercasefirst(col), " " => "_"), "-" => "_")
end

println(clean_column("My Column"))  # Outputs: my_column
```

Here is a more robust solution that includes handling of leading and trailing white spaces:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(replace(replace(strip(lowercasefirst(col)), " " => "_"), "-" => "_"), "__" => "_")
end

println(clean_column(" My Column "))  # Outputs: my_column
```
